title: A Survey on Text-Driven 360-Degree Panorama Generation
author: Hai Wang (University College London), Xiaoyu Xiang (Meta Reality Labs), Weihao Xia (University College London), Jing-Hao Xue (University College London)
relevance_why: The paper discusses methods for generating 360-degree panoramas from text, which may inspire novel techniques for audio-data representation, potentially enhancing Haohe's audio generation work through improved visual contexts for sound-related tasks.
background: The paper explores the synthesis of 360-degree panoramic images directly from textual descriptions, enabling immersive visual content that can be useful in VR, AR, and other creative domains.
contribution: This survey introduces a comprehensive overview of text-driven 360-degree panorama generation methods, identifying key algorithms and their applications while outlining current challenges and future research directions.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous studies focus on generating 2D images or limited field-of-view panoramas, often struggling with resolution and geometrical consistency in 360-degree outputs.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work systematically categorizes methods into two paradigms: Text-Only Generation and Text-Driven Narrow Field-of-View Outpainting, providing a clear framework for comparison.

key_innovation: Presents a structured approach to text-driven panorama generation, detailing various models and datasets, thus establishing a foundation for future work in the field.
real_world_impact: The advancements in 360-degree panorama generation can transform content creation in virtual reality and gaming, leading to richer user experiences.
limitations: The methods examined still face challenges in resolution and maintaining geometric fidelity, particularly at the poles of the panorama.

new_terms.equirectangular projection: **Equirectangular projection** is a mapping of spherical images into a rectangular format, which maintains consistent longitudinal spacing but can introduce distortions, especially at the poles.
new_terms.narrow field-of-view (NFoV): **Narrow field-of-view (NFoV)** refers to a limited angle of sight that captures a smaller section of a scene, contrasting with the broad perspective covered by 360-degree imagery.

open_sourcing: A curated project page with relevant resources and research papers is available at https://littlewhitesea.github.io/Text-Driven-Pano-Gen/
